info:
Nouns have gender: masculine or feminine.

Gender affects articles, adjectives, and pronouns used with the noun.

Most nouns form the plural by adding -s, though pronunciation often remains unchanged.

Gender is not always predictable; often must be memorized.

Articles precede nouns: le/la (the), un/une (a).
